ticket.title: Delete useless constructor in XML Serializers
ticket.original-body:
I think this constructor is useless, as to_xml triggers the second constructor, which is working fine. Jose commited at 29 April with an error in this not used constructor and it has been undetected for few months now. http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/2e9af3638d950ef840e1287f99e323887ec6a4c4#commitcomment-138733
Also, andreas's tests of new patch that fixed this undetected error are wrong, as they use to_xml which triggers other constructor (not that one he fixed).

Also, andreas's tests of new patch that fixed this undetected error are wrong, as they use to_xml which triggers other constructor (not that one he fixed).

Also, andreas's tests of new patch that fixed this undetected error are wrong, as they use to_xml which triggers other constructor (not that one he fixed).

version.body: Why do we need to delete the test? Does it pass or fail after your changes?
version.body-html: Why do we need to delete the test? Does it pass or fail after your changes?
version.title: Delete useless constructor in XML Serializers

version.body: The test is wrong, because it triggers working construcor of XML Serializer. This one, that I call 'useless' is not triggered by any other function, so why keeping it?
version.body-html: The test is wrong, because it triggers working construcor of XML Serializer. This one, that I call 'useless' is not triggered by any other function, so why keeping it?
version.title: Delete useless constructor in XML Serializers

version.body: In any case, Andrea have found an issue. Shouldn't we have a test for the issue he found?
version.body-html: In any case, Andrea have found an issue. Shouldn't we have a test for the issue he found?
version.title: Delete useless constructor in XML Serializers

version.body:
This test of his is wrong, because it triggers not this function that he fixed, but the other.
Post.where(:id => 12345).first.to_xml triggers second constructor(def initialize), not the one he fixed.
I'll try to fix his test and post a patch.
version.body-html:
This test of his is wrong, because it triggers not this function that he fixed, but the other.

Post.where(:id => 12345).first.to_xml triggers second constructor(def initialize), not the one he fixed.

I'll try to fix his test and post a patch.

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.body-html:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
